meanings.definition: The quality or state of being vain.
meanings.sent1: Her constant vainness made it hard for others to connect with her.
meanings.sent2: His vainness was evident in the way he spent hours in front of the mirror.
meanings.sent3: Despite her vainness, she still had a kind heart.
meanings.sent4: The vainness of his actions eventually led to his downfall.
meanings.sent5: The sheer vainness of his behavior was astonishing to witness.

meanings.definition: Excessive pride in one's appearance or achievements.
meanings.sent1: His vainness about his success made him unpopular among his peers.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't hide her vainness when receiving compliments on her looks.
meanings.sent3: His vainness reached new heights when he won the award.
meanings.sent4: The vainness in her eyes was unmistakable as she flaunted her new dress.
meanings.sent5: The level of vainness he displayed was truly remarkable.

meanings.sent1: The vainness of their efforts became apparent as they realized the task was impossible.
meanings.sent2: He finally accepted the vainness of trying to fix the old broken watch.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's attempt to explain the concept was met with utter vainness.
meanings.sent4: The project's vainness was evident when it failed to produce any results.
meanings.sent5: They soon discovered the vainness of their search for the lost treasure.
